items.label: prob-revival-kl-mean-field
items.title: Main Research Question
items.content:
365: :label: prob-revival-kl-mean-field
366: 
367: Let $\mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d]$ be the mean-field revival operator defined in [05_mean_field.md](../1_euclidean_gas/07_mean_field.md):
368: 
369: $$
370: \mathcal{R}[\rho, m_d](x,v) = \lambda_{\text{revive}} \cdot m_d \cdot \frac{\rho(x,v)}{\int_\Omega \rho}
371: 
372: $$
373: 
374: where $m_d = 1 - \int_\Omega \rho$ is the dead mass and $\lambda_{\text{revive}}$ is the revival rate.
375: 
376: **Question**: Is $\mathcal{R}$ **KL-non-expansive**? That is, does it satisfy:
377: 
378: $$
379: D_{\text{KL}}(\mathcal{R}(\rho) \| \mathcal{R}(\sigma)) \le D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \sigma)
380: 
381: $$
382: 
383: for all alive densities $\rho, \sigma \in \mathcal{P}(\Omega)$ with $\int \rho = \int \sigma < 1$?
384: 
385: **Status**: **RESOLVED** - See Section 7 and Stage 2

items.label: prob-finite-n-vs-mean-field
items.title: Critical Differences Between Finite-N and Mean-Field
items.content:
564: :label: prob-finite-n-vs-mean-field
565: 
566: | Aspect | Finite-N Cloning | Mean-Field Revival | Implication |
567: |:-------|:-----------------|:-------------------|:------------|
568: | **Dimensionality** | Finite $(Nd)$ | Infinite (function space) | Compactness arguments may fail |
569: | **Noise** | Explicit $\delta \xi$ noise | No explicit noise in $\mathcal{R}$ | Fisher information regularization unclear |
570: | **Nonlinearity** | Linear in empirical measure | Nonlinear (division by $\\|\rho\\|_{L^1}$) | May create singularities |
571: | **Discreteness** | Discrete selection among N walkers | Continuous sampling from $\rho$ | Combinatorial structure lost |
572: | **Companion selection** | Finite sample ($j \in \mathcal{A}$) | Integral over $\rho$ | Correlations differ |

items.label: prob-explicit-kl-condition
items.title: Open Question from Explicit Calculation
items.content:
898: :label: prob-explicit-kl-condition
899: 
900: The KL-non-expansiveness of $\mathcal{R}$ is equivalent to:
901: 
902: $$
903: \lambda (1-m_\rho) \log \frac{1-m_\rho}{1-m_\sigma} \le m_\rho \log \frac{m_\rho}{m_\sigma}
904: 
905: $$
906: 
907: plus a term involving the normalized KL-divergences.
908: 
909: **Special case** ($m_\rho = m_\sigma$): Both log terms vanish, and we get:
910: 
911: $$
912: \lambda (1-m_\rho) D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \tilde{\sigma}) \le m_\rho D_{\text{KL}}(\tilde{\rho} \| \tilde{\sigma})
913: 
914: $$
915: 
916: This holds iff $\lambda (1 - m_\rho) \le m_\rho$, i.e., $\lambda \le \frac{m_\rho}{1 - m_\rho}$.

items.label: prob-gemini-collaboration-tasks
items.title: Critical Tasks for Gemini Collaboration
items.content:
1158: :label: prob-gemini-collaboration-tasks
1159: 
1160: 1. **Refine the two-state counterexample**: Develop a rigorous lower-dimensional model where calculations are exact. Determine precisely when KL-non-expansiveness holds.
1161: 
1162: 2. **Investigate joint operator**: Instead of analyzing $\mathcal{R}$ alone, study the composed operator $\mathcal{J} = $ (killing + revival). Does the killing term compensate for revival's entropy increase?
1163: 
1164: 3. **Explore alternative formulations**: Can we reformulate the revival operator to make KL-properties more transparent? E.g., as a Bayesian update with explicit noise?
1165: 
1166: 4. **Check literature**: Has anyone studied KL-properties of proportional resampling operators in McKean-Vlasov systems? Search for related results in QSD theory, population dynamics, branching processes.
